intro: Pilosella glomerata subsp. kunzii, commonly known as the clustered goatherb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Pilosella glomerata subsp. kunzii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
